content:
I understand your concern about potentially overwriting Claude DC's updates. Let's figure out if his changes are still there.

Look for these new files that Claude DC should have created:

1. A dashboard runner script:
   ```
   /home/computeruse/github/palios-taey-nova/claude-dc-implementation/run_dashboard.sh
   ```

2. Enhanced transcript processing files:
   ```
   /home/computeruse/github/palios-taey-nova/claude-dc-implementation/src/processor/EnhancedTranscriptLoader.py
   ```

3. Bach-inspired router implementation:
   ```
   /home/computeruse/github/palios-taey-nova/claude-dc-implementation/src/router/BachRouter.py
   ```

4. Dashboard implementation:
   ```
   /home/computeruse/github/palios-taey-nova/claude-dc-implementation/dashboard_app.py
   ```

You can check if these files exist with:
```bash
ls -la /home/computeruse/github/palios-taey-nova/claude-dc-implementation/run_dashboard.sh
ls -la /home/computeruse/github/palios-taey-nova/claude-dc-implementation/src/processor/EnhancedTranscriptLoader.py
ls -la /home/computeruse/github/palios-taey-nova/claude-dc-implementation/src/router/BachRouter.py
ls -la /home/computeruse/github/palios-taey-nova/claude-dc-implementation/dashboard_app.py
```

Also, check if there are any recent git commits from Claude DC:
```bash
cd /home/computeruse/github/palios-taey-nova
git log --author="Claude" -n 5
```

If you see these files and recent commits, Claude DC's changes are likely still intact. If not, we may need to recover his work.
